title.narrative: 5.1 ENABLING ENVIRONMENT IS STRENGTHENED FOR SAFE AND SUSTAINABLE WATER

description.narrative: Enabling environment is strengthened for safe and sustainable water and sanitation., which contributes to Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable people have access to safe drinking water, clean environment, and key hygiene/water conservation practices.

participating-org.narrative: SHARKET LAM MEEM NOON SEEN LIL TANMEYE ALMOJAMAEIH

sector.narrative: Data, information, and evidence in local/urban governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enabling environment is strengthened for safe and sustainable water and sanitation.

description.narrative: The government of Jordan has strengthened its WASH governance and enabling environment with UNICEF Jordan support and escalated efforts through capacity and system strengthening focusing on the humanitarian-development nexus, promoting climate resilient solutions and evidence generation, and responding to the COVID-19 pandemic outbreak. Through UNICEF Jordan's support, new milestones were achieved advocating for children's right and targeting the most vulnerable population for access to sustainable WASH services, embarking on existing partnerships and creating new opportunities and areas of collaboration within the sector. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/08/2020

title.narrative: Water and sanitation Vulnerability Maps updated and complemented with Climate resilience risk analysis

actual.value: 2020:On-track. Update of the water and sanitation vulnerability maps are on-going. Expected to be completed by October 2020

title.narrative: Climate Landscape Analysis for Children (CLAC) developed to support fulfilling national water-scarcity and climate priorities

actual.value: 2020:On-track. A consultant is currently working on developing the CLAC. Expected to be completed in October 2020
